result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob A Danielson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob A Danielson was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:37 AM Defendant Jacob A Danielson in custody, appears via videoconferencing from Dunn Co. Jail with Attorney Jonathan Lundeen.  DA Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CF1, 17CM218, 17CM241.  Court advises Defendant of right to appear in person.  Defendant states he would like to get cases resolved and waives personal appearance.  Court questions Attorneys re: DOC submission.  DA notes recommendation from DOC on pg. 5 (17CM218), maximum is 30 days.  Atty. Lundeen advises he was not appointed on 14CF1 but is willing to represent on that case as well.  DA Froelich states position, noting violations.  Recommendation on 17CM218: $176 court costs, $200 DNA, $67 VWS.  30 days, time served.  On 17CM241: $176 court costs, $200 DNA, $67 VWS.  6-9 months.  Notes w/good time would be time served.  On 14CF1 (Count Two) 9-12 months concurrent.  219 days credit.  $176 court costs, $250 DNA, $92 VWS  State supports recommendations of DOC.  Victim rights complied with.  Atty. Lundeen states position and advises of Dunn County cases.  Recommends 9 months on 14CF1.  Defendant makes statement.  Court addresses Defendant.  Court sentences Defendant:  
- On 17CM218: 30 days incarcerated.  (Court notes 8 days good time, 22 days served).  Time served.  Civil judgment of $443.00 ordered. 
- On 17CM241: 180 days incarcerated, concurrent.  (Court notes 45 days good time, 130 days served).  Time served.  Civil judgment of $443 ordered.  
- On 14CF1 (Count Two) 365 days incarcerated, concurrent.  (Court notes 92 days good time, 219 days served).  54 days remaining to serve.  Huber granted for work release.  Civil judgment of $518 ordered.  
Court advises of appeal rights.  Court requests Dunn Co. Sheriff obtain DNA sample.  Adjourned at 10:03 AM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 30, 2020 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 1:06  13CT114  13CT126, 13TR177 are also included in this hearing. Defendant Jacob A Danielson appears by telephone from Stanley Correctional with attorney Liesl E. Nelson as counsel.   Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob A Danielson in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich - 13CT126 13CT114 and 13TR177 dismiss cases. In   14CF1  Plead to Ct 2  Dismiss Ct 1 & 3.  3 yrs probation consecutive to ES in 07CF18  Rest 30 days to det. Court Costs    Defense agrees  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of  Ct 2 in 14 CF1    Dismiss 13CT114, 13CT126, 13TR1177 and Ct 1 & 3 of the information in 14CF1  Court orders S/W 3 years probation consecutive to ES sentence in 07CF18  Conditions:  Restitution to be det w/i 30 days.  Court costs. DNA SC (no sample) Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Atty Nelson will mail the paperwork to the defendant.
Plea hearing on January 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

2:29 Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court: state is in Stanley Correctional facility at this time. Froelich: hopeful this matter can be settled prior to jury. Nelson agrees. Court:agrees.
filed by Sean Froelich
from Liesl Nelson objecting to continuance requested by the DA
for Continuance filed by Sean Froelich

8:47 am  
Defendant Jacob A Danielson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM STANLEY CORRECTIONAL with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Froelich addresses the court.  Victim is receiving unwanted phone calls and is requesting a NO CONTACT.  Nelson responds.  There was a condition of NO ABUSIVE CONTACT.  They share a child who is primarily with the victim.  Nelson objects to ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT.  Court Comm suggests a family court matter.  Nelson responds and wants def to be able to contact his 12 year old son.  Froelich: this case is set for jury next Friday.  Froelich is asking for NO CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM at her request.  VW Coordinator indicates victim has received letters from Mr. Danielson.   Court Commissioner responds.  COURT DENIES THE REQUEST FOR ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT.  Court reminds def of the NO ABUSIVE CONTACT condition.
for Bond Modification to introduce a no contact order with between the def and the victim
